title: Après le cessez-le-feu à Gaza, des dizaines de milliers de Palestiniens sur le chemin du retour
summary: Meurtris par deux ans de guerre, des Palestiniens ont pris la route par dizaines de milliers vendredi après l'annonce du cessez-le-feu dans la bande de Gaza. L'accord, approuvé par le gouvernement israélien, doit permettre le retour en début de semaine des 48 otages, dont 20 sont encore vivants, contre près de 2 000 prisonniers palestiniens. Récit d'Arnaud Miguet, collègue de France 2.

title: Les Gazaouis sur le chemin de retour vers un champ de ruines
summary: La Défense civile de Gaza a indiqué vendredi que près de 200 000 personnes étaient revenues dans le nord du territoire palestinien depuis l'entrée en vigueur du cessez-le-feu. De son côté, le Premier ministre israélien a déclaré espérer que son pays pourrait célébrer dès lundi soir "un jour de joie nationale" avec le retour de tous les otages encore détenus dans la bande de Gaza. Récit de B. Canat, France2.

title: La Défense civile annonce le retour d'environ 200 000 Gazaouis dans le nord
summary: La Défense civile de Gaza a indiqué vendredi que près de 200 000 personnes étaient revenues dans le nord du territoire palestinien depuis l'entrée en vigueur du cessez-le-feu. De son côté, le Premier ministre israélien a déclaré espérer que son pays pourrait célébrer dès lundi soir "un jour de joie nationale" avec le retour de tous les otages encore détenus dans la bande de Gaza. Les dernières infos avec Pauline Godart, notre envoyé spéciale à Jerusalem.

title: En direct : Israël a regroupé les détenus devant être libérés en échange des otages de Gaza
summary: Le président américain Donald Trump s'est dit confiant que le cessez-le-feu entré en vigueur vendredi entre le Hamas et Israël tienne. Selon la Défense civile gazaouie, plus de 500 000 personnes sont déjà revenues dans le nord de l'enclave palestinienne. En prévision de l'échange avec les otages à Gaza, les autorités israéliennes ont rassemblé dans deux prisons les détenus devant être libérés. Suivez notre direct.

title: Syrie : à Alep, après les affrontements, une désescalade fragile dans les quartiers kurdes
summary: Après deux jours d’affrontements meurtriers entre l’armée syrienne et les combattants kurdes des Forces démocratiques syriennes (FDS), un cessez-le-feu a été conclu à Alep. Mais sur le terrain, les habitants oscillent entre répit et crainte de nouvelles violences, explique notre Observateur.

title: Trêve entre Israël et le Hamas : vers un retour de la paix à Gaza ?
summary: Poussé par Donald Trump, un accord de cessez-le-feu entre Israël et le Hamas est entré en vigueur mercredi. L’annonce de cette trêve a été célébrée en Israël, dans l’attente du retour de ses otages, comme à Gaza, meurtrie par deux années de guerre qui ont fait des dizaines de milliers de victimes. Dès lors, faut-il croire en un début de paix ? Quelles sont les suites à attendre de ce plan de paix initié par les États-Unis ?

title: Les femmes et enfants de Gaza dans l’œil du cyclone
summary: Deux ans après le massacre du 7-Octobre, la paix semble enfin possible à Gaza. Lors de l’attaque de 2023, le Hamas a tué plus de 1 200 personnes et fait 251 otages, dont une vingtaine sont supposés encore vivants. Les mesures de rétorsion israéliennes ont fait au moins 68 000 morts, selon le ministère de la santé du Hamas, dont des milliers d'enfants, et des millions de déplacés au sein de l'enclave palestinienne. Les conditions de vie sont catastrophiques, la famine sévit et l'ONU a déterminé qu'un génocide a été organisé par le gouvernement de Benjamin Netanyahou.

title: More than 500,000 people return to Gaza City following ceasefire
summary:
More than 500,000 people return to Gaza City following ceasefire

More than 500,000 people have returned to Gaza City after a ceasefire was declared in the enclave, the civil defence agency said on Saturday.

Mahmud Bassal, a spokesman for the civil defence, said there had been a mass movement following the apparent end of Israel's assault on Friday.

"More than half a million people have returned to Gaza [City] since yesterday," he said, according to AFP.

As the dust settles amid hopes that the current round of conflict is over, Palestinians have started taking stock of two years of war.

More than 67,000 people have been killed by Israel's bombardment, which has also left most of Gaza in ruins.

The civil defence said on Saturday that 9,500 people were still missing under the rubble across Gaza.

Its teams have already begun rescue operations, recovering the bodies of some 155 people so far.

Read more: More than 500,000 people return to Gaza City following ceasefire

title: Gaza health ministry says 17,000 patients need urgent evacuation
summary:
Gaza health ministry says 17,000 patients need urgent evacuation

Director General of the Ministry of Health in Gaza on Saturday said that 17,000 patients need to travel immediately outside the Gaza Strip, Al Jazeera Arabic reported. 

"17,000 patients need to travel immediately outside the Gaza Strip. We seek to restore the minimum level of health services in the sector, " he said. 

"We are currently working to improve the health sector in the Gaza Strip and assess the extent of the damage," he added.

title: Erdogan: Israel must end its aggressive policies
summary:
Erdogan: Israel must end its aggressive policies

Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Saturday said that Israel must end its aggressive policies that pose a threat to the region and the security of its citizens.

“Israel must stand behind its pledge. It must end its aggressive policies that pose a threat to the region and the security of its citizens,” he said in an address in the Turkish province of Rize. 

He said that Turkey will support any initiative “that will permanently stop massacres, genocide that has been going on in Gaza for the last two years”.

title: More than 500,000 people return to Gaza City following ceasefire
summary:
More than 500,000 people return to Gaza City following ceasefire

Submitted by MEE staff on Sat, 10/11/2025 - 15:47
Thousands of bodies are being recovered from the rubble as Palestinians begin to return home
Palestinians make their way to Gaza City through the so-called "Netzarim corridor" from Nuseirat in the central Gaza Strip on 11 October 2025 (Eyad Baba / AFP)
Off

More than 500,000 people have returned to Gaza City after a ceasefire was declared in the enclave, the civil defence agency said on Saturday.

Mahmud Bassal, a spokesman for the civil defence, said there had been a mass movement following the apparent end of Israel's assault on Friday.

"More than half a million people have returned to Gaza [City] since yesterday," he said, according to AFP.

As the dust settles amid hopes that the current round of conflict is over, Palestinians have started taking stock of two years of war.

More than 67,000 people have been killed by Israel's bombardment, which has also left most of Gaza in ruins.

The civil defence said on Saturday that 9,500 people were still missing under the rubble across Gaza.

Its teams have already begun rescue operations, recovering the bodies of some 155 people so far.

Gaza: Palestinians recover bodies and survey destruction after Israeli withdrawal
Read More »

It added that it had received 75 distress calls since dawn today, and called on the Red Cross to coordinate with Israel to locate missing people as it lacks the resources and equipment to retrieve all the bodies from the rubble.

People returning to Gaza City have erected makeshift tents on the rubble, but lack adequate shelter as aid is not due to enter the Strip until Sunday.

Some 700,000 people were displaced from Gaza City and the north by intense Israeli bombardment and raids on the area in the weeks before the ceasefire came into force.

Meanwhile, the mayor of the southern Khan Younis governorate has reported that 85 percent of the area had been levelled by Israeli attacks.

He added that some 400,000 tonnes of rubble must be removed before any reconstruction work can begin.

The ceasefire agreement struck by Hamas and Israel stipulates an increase in aid deliveries into the Strip, as well as the opening of the Rafah crossing with Egypt, although questions remain around how the aid will be distributed and which agencies will be permitted to do it.

The UN said that some 170,000 metric tonnes of food, shelter and medicine is being held in warehouses outside Gaza and that aid workers are "ready and eager to act".

As part of the first phase of US President Donald Trump's 20-point plan, Gaza's crossings will fully reopen on Monday, allowing the entry of 400 aid trucks daily, expected to rise to 600 in the following days.

UN spokesperson Stephane Dujjaric said negotiations were ongoing with Israel to determine the amount of aid and frequency of deliveries, as well as the opening of more crossings.

"What has changed dramatically yesterday to today is the fact that the guns appear to have been silenced," Dujjaric said. "It's safer for our people to operate."

The UN agency for Palestinian refugees (Unrwa) said they had enough supplies in its warehouses to fill 6,000 trucks and that their teams stand ready to initiate distribution of lifesaving aid in the Strip.

Sam Rose, Unrwa's director of affairs in Gaza, told Middle East Eye that questions remained around the agency's ability to deliver the aid due to an ongoing Israeli ban on its activities in the occupied Palestinian territories.

While the current ban does not apply to Unrwa's activities within Gaza, the "no-contact" policy bars their trucks from entering the enclave.

Rose said the agency is preparing to get other organisations to bring their supplies into the Strip.

Gaza ceasefire: What we know about the first phase
Read More »

"What we're advocating for is that Unrwa be allowed to distribute those supplies once they get to Gaza," he told MEE. "The legislation says nothing about Unrwa's activities inside the territory."

Rose emphasised the centrality of Unrwa's expertise in securing an effective large-scale distribution of aid in Gaza.

"We've got enough food to feed everyone for between two and three months, and the population is starving. We've got shelter items for hundreds of thousands of people, blankets for over a million people."

Unlike other NGOs, Unrwa's long history of working in Gaza means it has secured the networks and community's trust to coordinate fast and effective aid distribution, he added.

"We have an ability. We're making everyone's lives much more difficult inside of Gaza if Unrwa is not permitted to be part of aid distribution," Rose said.

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: Israeli strike kills one in Lebanon, President Aoun denounces attack
summary:
Israeli strike kills one in Lebanon, President Aoun denounces attack

Lebanese President Joseph Aoun on Saturday condemned an overnight Israeli strike on civilian sites, which killed at least one person. 

"Once again, southern Lebanon has been the target of a heinous Israeli aggression against civilian installations, without justification or pretext," Aoun said. 

"The seriousness of this latest attack lies in the fact that it comes after the ceasefire agreement in Gaza," he added, questioning whether Israel now sought to expand its attacks on Lebanon.

The health ministry said one person was killed and seven wounded in the strike on the Al-Msayleh area in southern Lebanon, which Israel said targeted Hezbollah infrastructure.

Reporting by AFP

title: Hundreds of thousands march in London to call for 'lasting peace'
summary:
Hundreds of thousands march in London to call for 'lasting peace'

Hundreds of thousands of people marched in central London on Saturday in the wake of the Gaza ceasefire to demand "lasting peace" in the territory.

According to the Palestine Solidarity Campaign (PSC), which has coordinated national marches against Israel's genocide in Gaza since its launch in October 2023, some 500,000 people attended.

PSC director Ben Jamal warned that the US President Donald Trump's plan is "not a plan for enduring peace".

He added that it does "nothing about the root causes of violence", and pledged that the protesting will continue "until the Palestinian people are finally free".

This marked the 32nd national demonstration since Israel's genocide began, according to PSC.

Last weekend, Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood announced a fresh raft of measures to crack down on protests which she said were causing "considerable fear" for the Jewish community. The UK prime minister later announced further measures including potential powers to take action against specific chants at pro-Palestine protests.

title: 85 percent of Khan Younis flattened by Israeli attacks

The mayor of the southern Khan Younis governorate in Gaza has reported that 85 percent of the area has been levelled by Israeli attacks.

title: Israeli settlers launch multiple attacks on Palestinian farmers
summary:
Israeli settlers launch multiple attacks on Palestinian farmers

Israeli settlers have repeatedly attacked Palestinian farmers in the town of Aqraba, south of Nablus, Wafa news agency is reporting.

According to the report, settlers launched four attacks on the community on Saturday.

Activist Yousef Diriya reported that groups of settlers assaulted farmers and olive pickers in several areas of Aqraba, forcing them to flee.

Settlers also attacked olive pickers in the Ramallah and Salfit governorates.

According to Wafa, since 7 October 2023, settlers have conducted 7,154 attacks against Palestinians and their property across the occupied West Bank, killing 33 people.

title: Israeli authorities transfer Palestinian prisoners set for release between prisons
summary:
Israeli authorities transfer Palestinian prisoners set for release between prisons

Israeli authorities have begun transferring Palestinian prisoners slated for release to Ofer and Ketziot prisons, Haaretz is reporting.

Prisoners set to be released in the occupied West bank were transferred to Ofer Prison, while those expected to be released in Gaza or Egypt were sent to Ketziot.

title: Top US military commander visits Gaza, reaffirms no US troops to be deployed there
summary:
Top US military commander visits Gaza, reaffirms no US troops to be deployed there

The head of the US Central Command (Centcom) said on Saturday that he visited Gaza to discuss post-conflict stabilisation and insisted no US troops will be deployed to the Palestinian territory.

Admiral Brad Cooper wrote on X that he just returned from a trip to Gaza to discuss the creation of a Centcom-led "civil-military coordination centre" which will "support conflict stabilisation".

Reporting by AFP

summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 11 (MNA) – Condemning the Israeli brutal attack on southern Lebanon, the Hezbollah Resistance Movement strongly criticized the silence of the Arab world and the international community in the face of Tel Aviv's aggression.

title: Yemen Leader orders to suspend attacks on Israel
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 11 (MNA) – The leader of Yemen's Ansarullah Resistance Movement, Abdulmalik al-Houthi, has ordered a halt to strikes on occupied Palestinian territory, as well as attacks on merchant ships in the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden.

title: Israel launches drone attack in a car in Lebanon (+VIDEO)
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 11 (MNA) – The local media in Lebanon on Saturday reported a new Israeli drone attack on a car in southern Lebanon.

title: Iran unveils fixtures at 2025 IHF U-17 World C'ship
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 11 (MNA) – Iran’s fixtures at the 2025 IHF Men’s Under-17 World Championship were unveiled.

title: Fire breaks out in a hospital in Syria
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 11 (MNA) – A fire broke out on the fifth floor at the University Children’s Hospital in Damascus, caused by an electrical short circuit, hospital officials said.

title: Gen. Naeini hails strategic role of media during 12-day war
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 11 (MNA) – Spokesperson of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) Brigadier General Ali Mohammad Naeini lauded the strategic role of media in 12-day Israeli war, stating media have now become main players on the battleground.

title: Pezeshkian urges rapid solar power plants' expansion in Iran
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 11 (MNA) –Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian highlighted strategic importance of solar energy and called for accelerating solar power plant construction, saying his administration is determined to remove all barriers in this regard.

title: US troops begin arriving in Israel: source
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 11 (MNA) – US troops began arriving in Israel on Saturday under the pretext of monitoring the implementation of the Gaza ceasefire agreement.

title: Iran seize first ever women world champion: Cairo 2025
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 11 (MNA) – Atiyeh Sadat Hosseini makes history winning Iran’s first-ever women’s gold in World Para Powerlifting Championships, triumphing in women’s up to 61kg category.

title: محمدی: ۴۴۲۰ میلیارد ریال اعتبار مالیاتی به دهیاری‌های زنجان پرداخت شد
summary: زنجان- مدیرکل امور مالیاتی استان زنجان از واریز بیش از چهار هزار و ۴۲۰ میلیارد ریال اعتبار ارزش افزوده مالیاتی به حساب دهیاری‌ها و روستاهای فاقد دهیاری این استان در نیمه نخست امسال خبر داد.

title: همایش ملی آینده‌پژوهی و علوم انسانی در قم برگزار می‌شود
summary: قم – رئیس دانشگاه طلوع مهر از برگزاری همایش ملی «آینده‌پژوهی و علوم انسانی، گامی به‌سوی توسعه و تعالی ایران» در ۱۱ محور علمی در قم خبر داد.

title: علی داودی: بهانه جویی نمی‌کنم اما مصدوم بودم/ از مرد عذرخواهی می‌کنم
summary: ملی پوش سنگین وزن تیم ملی ایران پس از کسب مدال برنز رقابت های جهانی گفت: از این که نتوانستم در مجموع به مدالی دست پیدا کنم از مردم ایران عذرخواهی می کنم.

title: امام جمعه دیر: درمانگاه شهر شبانه‌روزی شود
summary: بوشهر- امام جمعه دیر گفت: خواسته مکرر مردم که در رسانه‌ها و فضای مجازی نیز بارها مطرح شده، تبدیل شدن درمانگاه حضرت مهدی (عج) به مرکز شبانه‌روزی است و این امر باید در اولویت قرار گیرد.

title: ضرورت برخورد اصولی و مؤثر با پدیده سگ‌های بلاصاحب در دیلم
summary: بوشهر- فرماندار دیلم بر ضرورت برخورد اصولی و مؤثر با پدیده سگ‌های بلاصاحب و دیگر حیوانات موذی در این شهرستان تاکید کرد.

title: فولاد هرمزگان پس از ۱۰ هفته شکست را در ساوه تجربه کرد
summary: بندرعباس ـ تیم فوتسال فولاد هرمزگان در هفته دوازدهم لیگ برتر فوتسال کشور در دیداری خارج از خانه به مصاف تیم سن ایچ ساوه رفت و با نتیجه ۲ بر یک مغلوب شد.
